website_summaries.verdict: If you are looking for a lightweight North Face jacket that has earned high marks from owners for its waterproof wear, this one is worth a look.
pros: Waterproof and flexible, making it ideal for outdoor activities in mild to cool conditions
Hood can be stowed in hidden collar pocket when not worn
cons: Not suitable for providing warmth, as it is basically a rain jacket
Some colors look different in person

customer_reviews.title: Great jacket but check sizing
customer_reviews.text: The jacket is fabulous and arrived quickly, but I disagree with the sizing on the other reviews. My husband is 5'9" and 165 lbs and the Medium was way too tight- had to order a large and return the medium
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer

customer_reviews.title: Amazing jacket! fully waterproof
customer_reviews.text: I have used this jacket in the snow and under heavy rain, it has kept me completelly dry. The hoodie can be tucked in under the collar so that is a nice feature. For reference Im 5’9, 220 lbs , I have a size large and it fits perfect.
customer_reviews.author: John Moran

customer_reviews.title: Great jacket/Surprisingly big collar
customer_reviews.text: I'm very pleased with this jacket. It was a bit of a surprise how big the collar on this is though. So if you are trying to go for a lower profile look this jacket may not be for you.
customer_reviews.author: At_a_minimum

customer_reviews.title: Great jacket, decent price
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for a trip to Iceland, Norway & Denmark this past summer, expecting to wear it almost daily in misty conditions. Well, we had great weather with a few rainy days and, as expected, this North Face handled the water exceptionally well while providing adequate breathability. Good looking jacket that I even wore on sunny, yet cool days as it was easy to ventilate. Well constructed with a hide-away collar hood. I was surprised that the collar has a light fleece coating which was a bit bothersome on warm days but I certainly see times this Fall & Winter when that fleece will provide needed warmth and wind protection. Also bought one for my wife & she's totally satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: jojo123

customer_reviews.title: Nice jacket for spring and fall
customer_reviews.text: The jacket appears to be very well made and should last a long time. However, keep in mind this isn't a winter jacket for use in northern climates where the temperature drops to zero F or lower. It should work well for temperatures in the 40s and 50s. I live in Orlando and needed a winter jacket for my upcoming trip to Norway in November. This jacket won't be warm enough for that. However, it should be excellent for a winter in Orlando where the temperature rarely drops to freezing or for spring or fall use up north.
customer_reviews.author: Wi-Fi enthusiast

customer_reviews.title: Great all weather jacket
customer_reviews.text: In Tidewater Virginia we have wide ranging weather. We have a saying, "if you don't like the weather wait a few days it will change." This unlined jacket is perfect. Unlined is perfect for the 90+ degs summers and layers underneath for days like today, 13 degs. Stops the wind and driving rain for when hurricanes skirt the coast. Well made, could use some internal pockets for cell phone etc..
customer_reviews.author: VSG

customer_reviews.title: No Velcro® Adjustable Cuff Tabs
customer_reviews.text: There are two things that I can not stand in my jackets, pit zips and elastic bands at the cuff. This jacket still does not have pit zips, but instead of Velcro adjustable cuff tabs, it has an elastic band in the cuffs. This is a poor decision, especially in a rain jacket, as the cuffs can not be sealed from rain seeping in. I returned this rain jacket and am still looking for a similar breathable jacket with adjustable cuff tabs and no pit zips.
customer_reviews.author: Lou. S

customer_reviews.title: That deception..!!
customer_reviews.text: I thought it was a coat and it's more like a cape to cover me from the rain, that deception
customer_reviews.author: RocheJM

customer_reviews.title: Just what the Doctor ordered!
customer_reviews.text: The jacket is perfect for what I was looking for to help me get through the "rainy season" here in California. The fit is perfect with enough extra room to allow for a sweater or sweatshirt if needed. I'm 5'10 and 205 lbs. and bought an XL. The one thing I'd warn prospective buyers is that the jacket IS NOT NAVY BLUE as the picture would illustrate. The caption states shady blue! Well it turns out to be a dark teal in color. Nice color but not Navy Blue.
customer_reviews.author: SU Fan

customer_reviews.title: Great light to middle weight jacket
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic light to middle weight jacket. This has proven to be quite warm and offer outstanding wind and rain protection. I have been wearing this jacket comfortably in 40 - 60 degree (F) temps.
customer_reviews.author: Benjamin Bruner

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic raincoat
customer_reviews.text: The hood is big, but rolls up nicely in the collar, which then velcros shut. The zipper is solid, and there is velco on the outer flaps to cover the zipper and protect it from rain. It is not too hot, so useful in warm rainstorms; but light-duty enough for a little bit of chill. (My North Face fleece fits underneath it, if I wanted layers). It rolls up to fit in a backpack and then comes out without permanent creases -- looks fine.
customer_reviews.author: Seth Pruitt

customer_reviews.title: Great jacket, comfortable and waterproof
customer_reviews.text: I've worn this several times in the rain and it is waterproof, rain beads up and falls right off. Has a hood so that is great for your head not needing a separate hat. Sometimes waterproof jackets are too slick inside to wear without long sleeves but this is comfortable in a tee. Has velcro on outside lining of zipper area to keep rain away from zipper.
customer_reviews.author: macdod

customer_reviews.title: A great jacket
customer_reviews.text: I used the jacket on my Alaskan cruise. It worked great keeping the wind away and keeping me warm. Love that it is so light weight.
customer_reviews.author: JGTSJ

customer_reviews.title: Kind of pricey...
customer_reviews.text: It’s basically a 100$ windbreaker. Not surprising for Northface, but I thought it’d have more insulation. The inside of the jacket is just a thin mesh lining and it’s still a bit chilly. Had to wear a sweater with it. Sizing is a tad bigger than the actual sizing so you might want to order something one size down from your usual clothing. It basically just looks good from the outside.
customer_reviews.author: TcJayLee

customer_reviews.title: It Does What it is Supposed to Do
customer_reviews.text: I've worn this thing enough times in enough rain to verify that it is indeed waterproof and effectively blocks the wind. While a little bulkier than some rain jackets, it is thin enough to be packed inside its own hood and conveniently shoved in a small daypack. In near freezing temperatures it can effectively be used as an outer layer (over a base layer and a fleece jacket) so it can be pretty versatile. The one complaint I have is that the hood is slightly annoying in how it hangs over the eyes and I will be reluctant to utilize it (unless the rain is really pouring down) for that reason. Overall, quality jacket.
customer_reviews.author: Matt M

customer_reviews.title: Its not a coat
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a winter coat. This billed itself as something that was a winter coat. This is an outside layer to wear over warm clothes so you dont get wet. 90 bucks for that? Also velcro and zippers feel very cheap for North Face products.
customer_reviews.author: Ed K

customer_reviews.title: Perfect jacket for spring & fall.
customer_reviews.text: My "older" husband needed a new coat to keep him dry and warm. He loves the higher neck as it has a fleece material and comes up high enough (but not too high) to protect his neck from the weather. In Michigan, you can use a great rain type coat many months of the year, so I'm sure he'll get lots of use out of it.
customer_reviews.author: Wizard50

customer_reviews.title: Ordered gray L, and got green XL (back it went)
customer_reviews.text: As for the quality and design, I'm not a big fan of NF as too many [old] people wear it and the designs are mediocre, mundane, tired looking and minimalistic. Not enough pockets in this thing. In my Eddie Bauer jacket I can put MacBook Air into the inner pocket. For the price you should be forgetting about Made in China, and you should be getting more practical clothing article that looks like you want to wear it. There you have it, I still don't own any NF stuff and don't want to either.
customer_reviews.author: Michael the II

customer_reviews.title: Cheapo ski component, usable in the south
customer_reviews.text: This jacket is great for skiing on the cheap--with this+generic northface fleece+synthetic longsleeve under armour type shirt I felt very warm (option to layer with wool sweater left on the table). Sadly, northface tries to rip you off if you need ski clothes--triclimate jackets, and my fleece, are compatible, but the outer layer is only available in the form of a gortex jacket that is the same price as the triclimate jacket to begin with! Anyway, it resisted snow flurries and wind very well, although not warm at all by itself. Bonus: it's " ski gear" that is useful in the south: its basically a rain jacket.
customer_reviews.author: scott

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for cool, wet weather
customer_reviews.text: I ordered the North Face Resolve jacket for wind and some rain protection. Also, I ordered in a x larger size in order to wear it over a bulky sweater if needed and I prefer a looser fit in outdoor clothing. It gives excellent wind protection and good rain protection. The fabric is durable and most comfortable in temps probably under 78 degrees when zipped. Layered, over a good sweater, I expect it will be perfect for temps down to just under 30 degrees, especially if walking, etc. It's a great, quality made jacket.
customer_reviews.author: Bill G

customer_reviews.title: Kept me dry for over an hour in constant rain.
customer_reviews.text: I wore this for over an hour in constant rain for my daughters soccer game. It kept me dry and warm the entire game. The hood is great and provided just enough shade to keep the rain out of my face without blocking my view. It also is stylish and comfortable to wear for both men and women. My husband wears it for work and loves it as well. I would definitely purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: Youaremysunshine

customer_reviews.title: Torrential Rain Tested
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with how dry I stayed and how the water droplets beaded up on the material, and it was in serious rain. Wish it packed into itself like some other jackets but I’m very pleased with my purchase. Fun color too.
customer_reviews.author: MadmanBlueBoxTop Contributor: Guitars

customer_reviews.title: Great lightweight rain jacket
customer_reviews.text: I like just about everything regarding this jacket. It's looks good, is lightweight, has a foldable/storable hood, a nice microfabric lined collar that feels good against the bare neck, seems very breathable, and the fabric really shows off the color (I ordered the black one). I would recommend this jacket to everyone.
customer_reviews.author: SteveInFrisco

customer_reviews.title: Great jacket
customer_reviews.text: Pop collar, where the hood is stored, adds flair to the jacket. Collar also lined with a felt like fabric, so super comfy around neck. Jacket is very comfortable in the body area with the mess lining inside ... Doesn't feel clammy against skin. Not sure about waterproofness yet ... Haven't had a chance to test it in a solid rainstorm. It repel water effortlessly where the water just rolls off jacket in a drizzle. Can't beat it for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Sam

customer_reviews.title: Roomy fit, but needs more pockets!
customer_reviews.text: It has enough space in the arms & chest to wear layers underneath - even something as bulky as a wool sweater. The only downside I can see is the lack of pockets - especially not having any kind of an interior pocket for wallet & phone. Planning to bring this while travelling and prefer to keep those valuable items on an inside pocket for security.
customer_reviews.author: LK

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Lightweight Jacket That Fights the Elements!! HIGHLY RECOMMENDED
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this jacket before a trip I was to Peru. The trip was a 4 day/ 3 night hike to Machu Picchu, during Peru’s rainy season. So I needed a jacket that would keep me warm, fight the elements, but not be over-bearing like a winter jacket. This jacket checked off all of the boxes. It did a great job of keeping me warm and blocking out the wind and rain, yet still being light and compact. I’m so happy I purchased this jacket after my tons of research. Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Taner

customer_reviews.title: Amazing
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my husband who always wears size medium in shirts and it fits him nicely. He is is 5'10, 180lbs for reference. I almost bought size large based off of reviews and was glad I didn't because it isn't tight or super loose. The mid grey and black color looks so nice. It's thin and light weight, perfect for windy and rainy weather. If you need a warm jacket north face has other insilated jackets or pair this with a sweater underneath. size up if it will be a super bulky sweater.
customer_reviews.author: Lynn

customer_reviews.title: It works pretty damn good.
customer_reviews.text: I ride a motorcycle and when it rains this jacket has kept me perfecly dry. I have waterproof pants *different brand* that will eventually become soaked after prolonged exposure. This jacket says dry, even after an hour sitting in heavy rain. Just shook the jacket dry. Its a really good wind barrier too.
customer_reviews.author: Zombie

customer_reviews.title: Typical North Face Quality & Functionality
customer_reviews.text: I am a downhill skier and spend a LOT of time on the slopes every year. One of the issues is that on slightly warmer days, I need a shell that is waterproof that allows me to layer a fleece underneath when needed. The Resolve Jacket provides me with just that function. Waterproof - even in cold wet rain - and breathable so I don't end up sweating. Overall an Excellent Jacket for what it is. And it has the typical North Face quality.
customer_reviews.author: Curtis H Christensen

customer_reviews.title: Almost liked it enough to keep it
customer_reviews.text: I had to send it back for two reasons, and they were on each wrist. A jacket like this should not have an elastic wrist, but a large diameter sturdy velcro strap. The look, fit and finish were all great, very nice overall, but the wrists really made this less useful than it should have been.
customer_reviews.author: Jammiman

customer_reviews.title: OK, but does have a problem or two
customer_reviews.text: Material of this jacket is fine. The fit is fine. BUT I have yet to figure out how to fasten it at the top (with zipper all the way up to collar bone). The hood seems to be made for someone with a head the size of a large watermelon. If I don't wear a baseball cap under the hood, it just drapes so far down over my forehead that it's a nuisance trying to keep it up higher than my eyes.
customer_reviews.author: drguerrant

customer_reviews.title: Solid windbreaker
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace an older North Face windbreaker. My main use for it is an outer garment for ATV riding so more of a windbreaker than a rain jacket. It fits well over a light sweatshirt (I’m 5’11” and 220, got a Large) and I can move just fine. I like the fold-away hood since I’m wearing a helmet. Nice to have it if it does rain and I’m on foot.
customer_reviews.author: Rob Shealy

customer_reviews.title: Wore it skiing. Kept me dry and I’m a terrible at skiing
customer_reviews.text: Great jacket. I didn’t realize it did not have the standard 4 pockets that most North Face jackets have. (Why only 4 stars). So you only have the two hand pockets - most/many NF jackets have two breast pockets.
customer_reviews.author: Mike W

customer_reviews.title: Nice Rain Jacket
customer_reviews.text: A touch on the large side. I have been wearing xxl in shirts for years. I read that this run a bit large and I wanted a bit of space for layering for hiking/primitive camping. There is room to spare but I am ok with that. It is very lightweight and seems to be well made. I tested it out with a 2 mile hike around my neighborhood during a steady downpour. Very impressed. All stayed dry.
customer_reviews.author: Charlie

customer_reviews.title: Overall worth the price
customer_reviews.text: Overall great. Sleek and vibrant color, and stylish. Fits exceptional, the only thing I would say is that it is NOT long down the waist. I was expecting it to be longer since I'm used to snowboarding jackets that are oversized and sag. Its comfortable and will do the job to fend rain and wind, it's a lightweight jacket. I would give it 5 stars if it was just a little longer. (I am 5 foot 8 170 pounds and it goes to my belt) and this is a large.
customer_reviews.author: James Sullivan

customer_reviews.title: Not a cold weather jacket, very expensive windbreaker.
customer_reviews.text: No liner, this is just a very thin shell. No warmth at all. This jacket would be suitable for warm rain on a hot summer night. Any situation where you want to stay dry but not warm. Waste of money if you're looking to stay warm in cold weather.
customer_reviews.author: RJ Jensen

customer_reviews.title: Best quality rain jacket, hands down
customer_reviews.text: I bought the same rain jacket for my husband, but in mens. It is by far the best quality and the best brand for a rain jacket. I had my last North Face one for 10+ years and FINALLY this year needed a new one. So after my husband kept buying cheap jackets, I finally told him he needs to buy this one. Hands down the best.
customer_reviews.author: Nicole P.

customer_reviews.title: runs a little big
customer_reviews.text: I bought my fiance a size small so he has a light jacket to wear during our trip to Japan. He ended up not wearing it as the weather quickly changed from rainy and windy to downright 100% hot and humid. He mentioned he didn't want to wear it either because it was too big on him. He's usually a small as he's pretty fit and works out often. But the past few months he gained some weight from being too busy at work to stay fit. Still pretty big on him and he's one to like comfortable fitting clothes. He loves the color and style of the jacket but the size brought it down a star.
customer_reviews.author: Rachelle

customer_reviews.title: Great Jacket
customer_reviews.text: My husband loves this jacket. It's lightweight and breathable yet serves as a windbreaker. It can be worn with his fleece Northface liner under it as a light winter coat. He loves that the hood folds inside the collar when not needed. This jacket is very versatile and multi purpose. Not to mention it's actually a rain jacket.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda Holloway

customer_reviews.title: Nice... But.....
customer_reviews.text: Nice jacket but it is not a "little big" . If anything, a Medium is truly a tight medium across the chest. Don't wear anything under the jacket other than a T shirt or it will be tooooo tight. Better to have a size larger for room to move.
customer_reviews.author: J. F.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent jacket
customer_reviews.text: Great quality item from North Face. Item arrived quickly and was packaged well. The color and fit were perfect. If you plan on wearing this jacket over heavy or bulkier clothes I would suggest going up one size. Extremely waterproof as I got caught in an unexpected downpour and I stayed completely dry. Sharp looking jacket.
customer_reviews.author: Chuck Baji

customer_reviews.title: The best jacket for the money ever!
customer_reviews.text: Omygosh! This is an excellent jacket! Redundant closures, beautifully fitting, very smooth feeling, absolutely wonderful. The whole family wants to wear this coat but my son is 5 feet 7 inches and 285 pounds. This coat fits him SO well. He keeps it on a chair at the table with his backpack so that after breakfast he can throw it on and meet his (6:15 am) bus! Thanks Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Glennie58

customer_reviews.title: Sent Back for Exchange for smaller size
customer_reviews.text: Had to return this product to exchange for a smaller size. I usually require an XLarge in a men's jacket, but this XLarge felt like I was swimming in it, especially in the waist area. If you are an XLarge with a big belly this would be a good fit for you. However, if you are an XLarge with broad shoulders and no large belly, I'd go with a Large.
customer_reviews.author: Brent Wells

customer_reviews.title: Great jacket with only one drawback.
customer_reviews.text: Love this jacket. The lining makes it so comfortable compared to the jackets where your skin touches the membrane. The one upgrade I would add is pit zips.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Jacket!
customer_reviews.text: This North Face jacket is perfect for Springtime. It’s lightweight, travels easily, and looks great! I love the high collar. It covers my long neck! The fit is large, so you may think about getting a size smaller. I’m 6’ 235 lb. and got L, even though I usually wear XL, and it fits perfectly! Awesome jacket!
customer_reviews.author: HouTXGuy

customer_reviews.title: North Face Jacket
customer_reviews.text: Jacket is great one think to mention is the hoodie is not attached to the collar like most rain jackets. I use the jacket for skiing mainly with a sweatshirt underneath but it does fine in the rain aswell
customer_reviews.author: Jack M.

customer_reviews.title: I would recommend
customer_reviews.text: This was a great jacket. It fit really well for 2 XL. It was a gift that unfortunately was returned. The only problem was I thought the hood was detachable but didn't ask and that was what I needed. Great price and material was super light. Not heavy at all. Sad it was sent back.
customer_reviews.author: Rosalie N. Lopez

customer_reviews.title: Great Jacket
customer_reviews.text: Bought this light weight North Face jacket for my husband on one trip to Florida this winter. The jacket fit him perfectly and he wears it whenever the temperature is 40 or above.
customer_reviews.author: Bulldog mom

customer_reviews.title: A perfect fit.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this as a gift for my boyfriend for Christmas. I was actually worried it would either be way to big or way too small, as he's pretty strictly an XL. It fit perfectly without being snug or baggy in any spots. Really helps to provide some water proofing over your sweaters when you don't really want the hassle of dealing with a coat.
customer_reviews.author: Alexandria Cholewinski

customer_reviews.title: The zipper is junk
customer_reviews.text: This would have been a five star review except that the zipper started coming apart 2 weeks after receiving the jacket. Both the velcro and the zipper are very cheap. I've gotten better quality at Wally World. Very disappointing for an otherwise high quality jacket. Way to save a buck.
customer_reviews.author: L. Ekle

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight and versatile
customer_reviews.text: This jacket is super lightweight, but cuts the wind and rain really well. I wouldn’t use this by itself if you’re looking for something warm but it’s better than nothing. I like that the hood can be folded up into the collar so it can be used as a casual and nice windbreaker and I also like that the zipper down the front is closed on top with sections of Velcro to keep the wind from coming through to your core. The draw string at the waist makes for a tight fit if you’d prefer or you can let it out to be more loose. Nice jacket. I wear it a few times a week.
customer_reviews.author: MWAT805

customer_reviews.title: New England Weather
customer_reviews.text: Bought this Winter coat when I moved from Sunny Southern California to the awful weather of Boston. It came in handy real quick with temps that didn't get above 19 degrees for two months and a ton of snow. It was almost too warm of a jacket. The thermal lining really keeps your body heat in. I now live on the West Coast again but will keep it when I go to the snow for fun.
customer_reviews.author: jack

customer_reviews.title: It's NorthFace!
customer_reviews.text: My first ever NorthFace product in my entire years of life and I was not let down. Not only did I get this jacket for a great price, it is great for spring and fall; and especially during rain storms. Not one drip of water on the inner seam and the hood has a brim-like front that pushes the water forward -- away from the body.
customer_reviews.author: Nick Marino

customer_reviews.title: Good Jacket. Good Price. Fast shipping from Seller.
customer_reviews.text: Good jacket. Happy with the purchase, however I wish North-face (and other outdoor clothing companies) made XS sizes more accessible and for more of their products. North-face has always tended to run large for my body type (5’5”) I typically wear Small or XS for most clothing, and even with that, north-face XS it’s still a bit large and loose. In this case it’s not a problem, need something to wear layers with. That being said, again, happy I found this jacket in an XS. Properly blocks rain and wind and I appreciate the soft liner up near the collar.
customer_reviews.author: AntBell

customer_reviews.title: I like the color and styling and it's remained pretty water-proof
customer_reviews.text: my only gripe is that the hood is so big on mine that I really can't use it unless I'm wearing a helmet (which isn't that often). There's no cinch in the back, just the two on the sides. I like the color and styling and it's remained pretty water-proof. The zipper has bloopied from the bottom a couple of times by separating. This jacket isn't meant to last 15 years but it's nice for 1 or 2 I would guess.
customer_reviews.author: Simon G.

customer_reviews.title: Love this jacket!
customer_reviews.text: My third resolve jacket. The previous jacket is still in use but has small tears and rips. But it lasted me 11 years! Awesome product from the north face!!!
customer_reviews.author: C65

customer_reviews.title: Quality north face😁
customer_reviews.text: Runs big go one size down. Quality jacket. Very pleased so far. Let's see if it's water proof? We'll see. Sure it will. Feels like it may leak around shoulder seams and sticks to five o'clock Shadow at the collar. Collar feels like a felt material. I'm going to rate it a three for now being I can't send it back.
customer_reviews.author: Sg

customer_reviews.title: Great rain jacket.
customer_reviews.text: Saturday night football, 45 degree, sweatshirt underneath, constant rain for all 4 quarters - stayed nice and dry. Keep in mind, not insulated. Did great job of keeping me dry.
customer_reviews.author: Gregg

customer_reviews.title: Buy this jacket if you want to keep yourself dry
customer_reviews.text: Nice TNF Jacket. Tested the day it arrived in rain whilst riding my motorcycle and arrived home as dry as I left. Highly recommended. Its a true to size item so please consider this when buy it. The item arrived more than 24 hours before expected ! Pike to Peak + Amazon = Success
customer_reviews.author: john catera

customer_reviews.title: Great fit! Looks good!
customer_reviews.text: Exactly what I was looking for. I didn't get this to keep me warm I got it to keep me dry and looking good. It has enough room for a decent thickness sweater underneath. Read some complaints about the hood, maybe they ordered a larger size because my hood was perfect, it covers my head and goes right above my eyes. Has 2 zip-up side pockets a hood and waist cinch. I'm 6'0" 185lbs. Athletic build (41in chest, 31in waist with rounded shoulders) and a medium fits me great, with good maneuverability.
customer_reviews.author: A. Stephens

customer_reviews.title: Keeps me warm and most definitely water proof!
customer_reviews.text: I'm a Male, 5'10 and size XL in most clothing. I saw someone else's review about the sizes running big. So, I bought a size Large and it fits perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Fidencio M. Lopez

customer_reviews.title: Just do your research before ordering. Jacket provides no warmth.
customer_reviews.text: I typed in “warm waterproof jacket” under search and this jacket by the photo, appeared to be one. When it arrived, it was a lightweight wind breaker that stops a little bit of rain. The jacket provides absolutely zero warmth!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: My sons favorite jacket
customer_reviews.text: My son loves this jacket he works in a freezer it keeps him warm and dry
customer_reviews.author: Renee

customer_reviews.title: Great jacket but with a flaw.
customer_reviews.text: This jacket is light, comfortable with it's mesh liner, and waterproof. It looks good. The flaw is in the hood. While you can tighten the perimeter, you cannot adjust the hood front to back. When I tighten the cord it pulls the hood over my face. I will either have to wear a ball cap with it or tack the hood to reduce it's reach.
customer_reviews.author: ScottB

customer_reviews.title: Great jacket with one flaw.
customer_reviews.text: This jacket is light, comfortable with it's mesh liner, and waterproof. It looks good. The flaw is in the hood. While you can tighten the perimeter, you cannot adjust the hood front to back. When I tighten the cord it pulls the hood over my face. I will either have to wear a ball cap with it or tack the hood to reduce it's reach.
customer_reviews.author: ScottB

customer_reviews.title: Its alright
customer_reviews.text: I really liked it at first but after more wears I've been having zipper issues. It's a cheap zipper and sometimes it gets stuck and will not retract. I don't like the valco on the jacket. I wouldn't may more than $45 for it so don't pay full price for this jacket.
customer_reviews.author: savchuktaras

customer_reviews.title: Best Travel Jacket
customer_reviews.text: I had this jacket for many years and lost it this summer while traveling internationally. This is the best travel / roll up in a ball and shove in your suitcase, while doing it's job (keeping you dry) jacket you can buy.
customer_reviews.author: Ron J Lackey

customer_reviews.title: Waterproof, but not warm
customer_reviews.text: This is another quality Northface product that looks great and fits perfectly (loose). I was disappointed that it did advertise as being warm, but it really is a lightweight shell. I wear a fleece under it to make it suitable for my needs. I live in California, so it actually works out nice because it won't be too warm in the Spring if it was lined. Overall, I would highly recommend this jacket.
customer_reviews.author: Julie B

customer_reviews.title: Thin but great windblocking. When fully zipped the collar is cozy
customer_reviews.text: I like this jacket because it’s very light. The wind blocking material makes it warmer than some of my north face hoodies, but there is no insulation in this jacket besides in the collar. product_meta.title: The North Face Men's Resolve Waterproof Jacket
feature_bullets: READY FOR RAIN. This men's rain jacket is features a waterproof shell with a stowable hood. From the trail to the town, this jacket is ready for everyday travels.

STAY DRY. This waterproof jacket is made with a 100% nylon ripstop DryVent fabric and features a Durable Water-Repellent (DWR) Finish. Sealed seams and a storm flap with a hook-and-loop closure covers the center front zip so water stays out.

STANDARD FIT. Lightweight and designed for hiking, this standard fit jacket helps you seek out uncharted territory in any weather with a waterproof, windproof layer. This rain jacket also features a breathable mesh lining and a fully adjustable hood.

CUSTOM FIT. This versatile rain jacket features an attached, adjustable hood that stows in the collar when the weather clears up. Elastic cuffs fit over gloves and a hem cinch-cord lets you customize the fit at the waist.
SECURE STORAGE. Secure-zip hand pockets safety store your phone and wallet while you're on the go.
